title: Drawing, "Profile Figure of a Standing Woman Wearing a Cloak and Hat.", 1862
medium: Recto: Graphite on cream wove paper; verso: Graphite, brown and gray crayon(?)
markings: Stamped in ? ink, at lower right: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt 457d).
inscribed: Verso: Inscribed in graphite, upside-down, along bottom edge [recent inscription]: (112)
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description: Six studies of soldiers' heads; three across top and bottom. Four corner heads wear same hat with circular, flat top; those in upper left and lower right have "28" on hat.  Soldier in lower row center wears Zuave headdress.  Verso: standing woman with long hair, in profile, wearing cloak and hat. Several upside-down heads sketched at top of page.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Profile Figure of a Standing Woman Wearing a Cloak and Hat.", 1862.
1862. Recto: Graphite on cream wove paper; verso: Graphite, brown and gray crayon(?). Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-112.
